intro: The year 2000 witnessed the outbreak of the Second Intifada, a more intense and violent Palestinian uprising against Israeli occupation. This period was marked by significant casualties on both sides and a further deterioration of the peace process.

events.title: Second Intifada Begins
events.text: The Second Intifada, also known as the Al-Aqsa Intifada, began after Ariel Sharon's provocative visit to the Al-Aqsa Mosque compound in Jerusalem. It was characterized by increased armed confrontations and suicide bombings.

events.title: UN Security Council Resolution 1322
events.text: The UN Security Council adopted Resolution 1322, deploring acts of violence, particularly the excessive use of force against Palestinians, and calling for an immediate cessation of violence.
